11.content:
Deep within the former hell, one female were flying around the area. It was Reiuji Utsuho, an Yamagarasu who have the ability to manipulate the atoms. She was doing her job looking out the hell until she spotted something strange. She saw an small island that had metal gate on it.

“Inyu? What’s that?” Utsuho said.

She flew down to the island and looked at the seal, and it had the paperus that wrote Hakurei seal on it. She didn’t know why or how it came here until one of the person came to her. It was kaenbyo Orin, the hell cat who gets the souls from above.

“Hiya okuu, say..what’s with this place?” Orin asked.

“Orin..I don’t know, i just came across with it.” Okuu replied.

Just then, they both felt an dark power from the sealment. They quivered little from the power until...

GYAAAA!!!

Both okuu and Orin flicked and flew back as the seal bursted in black flames, the seal faded away and the wall suddenly got cut in four ways. As it went down, okuu and Orin gotten ready to fight as deep in the cave, a man with chained shackles on both his arms and his stomach were so thin they could see the ribs, came out.

“I’m free..at last!!” Man shouted, “after 300 years of sealment, i am free!”

“Hey, who’re you!?” Orin shouted.

The man looked at the two and just grinned, engulfing in black flames and came infront of Orin and grabbed her face.

“Until my body and soul regenerates, I’ll use you as my vessel.” Man Said.

“”Not if I can help it.” Okuu shouted.

She shot many bullets but he dodged it still grabbing Orin. She tried to escape but he summoned a tornado made from lava and darkness. Okuu shoutes her name as Orin shouted, the tornado went away, revealing Orin herself.

“Orin?” Okuu spoke softly.

She then saw her with red/purple eyes at her and she just smirked.

“I shall exact revenge...but first, you must disappear.” Orin spoke in different tune.

“Orin!?” Okuu spoke in fear.

She summoned a Tantō knife and slit her wrist, and the blood ran, making a chains and spikes, and attacked her.

“Have fun dear.” Orin spoke.

She then disappeared in darkness while Okuu fought the blood chains. 4 minutes later Orin was at the house in the forest. She went in and noticed nobody was home. She went upstairs and got to the bed room and laid down as it was night time.

“300 years...since master have named me Mu, the nothing.”

The man was none other then Mu himself. After 300 years of sealment, the seal became weak so he could get out freely.

“I should sleep now so I could get some rest.” Mu said.

He then closed his eyes and went to sleep..
11.title: Story begins here.

111.content:
Next day came and it was raining. Mu were sittin on the chair looking at the rain for moment. He clearly remembers the day when the Hakurei Miko and the others sealed him in the former hell. It Was a nightmare for him as he never ate or drank, he withered as he was about to die. The only reason he was alive is because he achieved the dark magehood that prolonged his lifespan and conserved his energy to live.

“What should I do now...maybe I should see my old friend.” Mu said.

He got his dark robe and got outside. He felt the rain on his skin, feeling nostalgic for many years and then he walked toward the mountain. It took an hour for him to reach the mountain and when he got to the destinaion he saw the small crater.

“So it’s still there...just like yesterday.” Mu said smiling.

As he was about to look for his old pal, he saw a wolf Tengu coming down. He had thoughts on what he shall do and pretended to be Orin.

“Halt! Why are you, a hell cat being in this area?” Tengu asked.

“Why, I was just strolling around, that’s all.” Mu spoke in cutesy voice.

“Bullshit! You didn’t come here for no reason!” Tengu responded.

My just made an ‘tch’ noise and summoned a Tantō knife and spoke a few words and slit his wrist. The Tengu were little shocked laughed at him as he bleeded.

“Ha, So your just going to hurt yourself? How laugha-“

STAB STAB STAB!!

The Tengu felt horrible pain as she looked, the chains soaked in blood hit her shoulders and her heart, piercing her heart.

“Dark chains.” Mu spoke.

The Tengu coughed blood, said nothing and fell to her death. The chains came back and dropped into a puddle of blood. He healed himself with dark heal and made an fist.

“Hm, still intact and good.” Mu said.

“It sure was master.”

Mu turned and saw the little oni. It was Kooni, his old friend and partner. Mu looked at her and smiled, and petted her head.

“I’m back.” Mu spoke.

“Master, Master..!” Kooni spoke.

She then..
111.title: Remeeting the friend

1111.content:
“Master...uwaaan!!” Kooni cries.

Mu tilted his head from her crying, then he hugged her gently. Kooni knee the body weren’t Mus, but she could sense his dark presence as she continued to cry, he hugged her gently.

“It have been 300 years since you were sealed, master.” Kooni said, “I was lonely..and couldn’t think anything else but you.”

“I’m sorry Kooni, for taking too long to get out.” Mu replies.

He then got off from her and stood up, raising his hands at her.

“Why don’t we go back home.” Mu spoke. “We will be cold if we continued to get drenched in rain.”

Kooni then smiled and got his hand and walked back to the house. Once back, they took off the wet cloths and hung up to dry, then they looked at each other. Kooni were little embarrassed by showing her body while Mu says nothing.

“S-Say Master?” Kooni spoke.

“What it is Kooni?” Mu asked.

“Is it ok...for us to bond closer?” Kooni said with blush face.

He had the idea of what she wanted, and he came to her and kissed her cheeks.

“Are you sure? My real body won’t be able to regenerate until the further notice.” Mu asked.

“It’s alright, if it was you master.” Kooni replied.

He then summoned two shadows and a ghost. It fused together, revealing to look like Mu himself.

“Go find my sworn enemy and fight them.” Mu said.

The shadow nodded and left the scene as Mu turned to koonis attention, he lightly got her face and gotten closer.

“I’ll make your day sweet and good, my little oni.” Mu said.

“Mas...ter.” Kooni spoke softly.

They kissed and started to mate together...
1111.title: Onis tears

11111.content:
At Hakurei shrine, where the great barrier strives, lives Hakurei reimu, the current Nijo of the Hakurei shrine. She was brushing the front area until she gets an visit from her witch visit Marisa Kisirasme.

“Hey reimu! How’s everything?” Marisa asked.

“Nothing unusual going on these days.” Reimu said, “no incidents, but I do need more faiths and such to donate money.”

“Hehe, that’s our Reimu.” Marisa said wid with smile.

“What’s that supposed to mean!?” Reimu said in annoying tone.

Just then, they felt the disturbing feeling and looked up and saw the the cloud turn from blue to shard red. They didn’t know what what going on until Reimu noticed someone’s presence and threw a demon warding needle and hit one of the shadow and it bursted in blood.

“What the hell?” Marisa spoke softly.

“I don’t like this feeling.” Reimu replies.

They gotten ready to fight as two more shadows came out and mans shadow orbs were summoned.

“Must..kill...Hakurei...must...kill...the traitors...humanity...must...perish.” Shadows spoke in unison.

They then attacked reimu and the two girls dodged the attack and countered the attack. The shadows were fast and agile, and quickly shot more shadow orbs on them. One scratches Marisa and it completely hit her hard.

“Marisa!!” Reimu shouted.

“Look at...peat go...your turn...vermin...” shadow spoke.

“Not if I can help it.” Reimu said.

She used her seal and threw toward them. They dodged it until it missed and they got hit and they both exploaded in blood, leaving ones head intact. Reimu were worried about Marisa but came to the shadow.

“Tell me, who sent you here?” Reimu demanded.

The shadow were silent for moment and laughed.

“The dark mage....Mu....have returned....he will..destroy humanity....and create..new humanity.” Shadow spoke.

With that the head exploaded in blood. Reimu was in shock to hear what he was hearing and went to Marisa.

“Marisa, are you ok?” Reimu asked.

“I’m fine, just a scratch.” Marisa said, “did that thing say anything?”

“He said something about dark mage coming back....I heard something about it but where did I hear that?” Reimu said.

“I have.”

The gap opened and revealed to be Yukari Yakumo, the strong gap Youkai who also protect the barriers.

“Mu, the one who used to be a human 300 years ago, became a dark mage and became insane with power. Luckily, me, the elder of human village, and your ancestor have imprisoned him for long time. I sensed that he’s up to no good as his seal is broken off.” Yukari said.

“This is bad.” Marisa said.

“How should we find him?” Reimu asked.

“He might be hiding somewhere where nobody is allowed to go in without his permission. I’ll try to do my best.” Yukari said.

Reimu and Marisa nodded as Yukari left, Reimu got Marisa up to treat her wounds.

Back at the house, Mu finished mating with Kooni and she was in delight. They were in bed as Mu were sitting up, Kooni looked at him.

“Are you going to seek grandmaster herself?” Kooni asked.

“I thought I told you to keep that book safe.” Mu said.

“Yes, but the scarlet family stole it for some experiment issue.” Kooni replied.

Mu sighed and got up, being nude. Kooni still tugged in the bed sheets smelling mus smell and got up.

“I guess I need to find my master.” Mu said, “Kooni? Care to join?”

“Would I?” Kooni spoke in delight.

They got their cloth on and went out to get the book from the sdm...
11111.title: Dark warning

111111.content:
At the scarlet devil mansion, one librarian and her assistant were reading a book on the magic book. It was patchouli Knowledge and Koakuma themselves, and once patchouli finished reading the book, she closed it.

“Koakuma, would you kindly give me some cup of tea?” Patchy asked.

“Yes, master knowledge.” Koakuma replies.

As she left, patchouli leaned back, remembering the book that Koakuma got afraid from. She got up and looked for it. She looked up and down, left and right until she noticed a secret door that were hidden from the place.

“Did we have secret room?” Patchouli spoke.

She pushed back and the door opened, leading it downward. She felt chill and dark presence nearing her but she mustered her courage and went down. As she went down, there were many bricks on the walls and once the stairs ended, another door were there, but this time it had sealment. The seal had dark aura on it and it also had an unknown letters on the paper.

“What is this thing?” Patchouli spoke.

Just then, a tremor shook the sdm. Patchouli didn’t know what was going on as she was going up the stairs, the dark aura flared up, turning her attention.

‘Return thou to me, my follower’

“What? Who’s saying that?” Patchouli asked.

‘My follower, return thou to me now’

Patchouli were getting scared and suddenly she started to hallucinate. She saw many dark robed spirits fly around her and one of the spirit stopped at her and made an skull faced spirit at her.

“No, nooo!” Patchouli shouted.

She used one of her spell cards to destroy the spirits but with no harm, and the door were not harmed as well. Outside the sdm, Kooni fought Meiling as Mu walked through the hallway. As he approaches the gate toward the library, he meets the head maid, Sakuya.

“You shall not trespass any further you imbecile.” Sakuya said.

“Who’s the embecile, you mortal? You shall not disrespect me.” Mu spoke.

Sakuya then stopped time and threw many knives at him and clock moved again. She thought she got the the upper hand but when the knives hit him some of his body, the blood floated and turned to her.

“Blood needles.” Mu spoke.

The blood needles hit Sakuya and she took out her knives to continue to fight until the bloody chains got her body and dragged her to the underground. He went to the library and noticed the librarian and the assistant and just smiled.

“I see you two managed to kept my book safe. I thank you, now it’s time to give it back.” Mu said.

“Orin? But why would an hell cat would!?” Patchouli spoke.

He summons two blood javelins and strikes their shoulder. They coughed blood as Mu just walked, patchouli couldn’t believe what she is seeing. Mu saw the hidden room and went down and once arriving at the door, he touches the seal.

“By the name of dark mages, I release you, grandmaster Sakura Bluebelle!” Mu spoke.

The seal broke off and the door opened, revealing an room filled with torture devices. He went inside and got the book that had red ruby in the middle that wrote:

“Omega art and obituary.”

“Grandmaster Sakura...I can finally meet you again.” Mu said.

He then got out of the room and out of the sdm until he noticed...
111111.title: The book itself

12.content:
In the land of Gensokyo, where the forgotten and the lost resides, stood a man who lived in the human village. His name was Kagero Koizumi, an average human who was a guardsmen who looked after the gate at the entrance of the village. He was well respected man due to his respect for the villagers and defended the village with valor. One day, after his work he was walking toward his home until he overheard someone’s talk.

“Have you heared about the legendary artifact that grants the wielder unlimited power?” One man said.

“Yeah I heard, but it’s dangerous.” Other man replied.

Kagero was intrigued by this and came toward them.

“Excuse me sirs, What is this artifact you’re talking?” Kagero asked.

“Oh, haven’t you heard? There’s a rumor spreading through the village about this artifact that would grant the person unlimited power, but it’s dangerous.” One man said.

“Why?” Kagero asked.

“Because that artifact is rumored to be hidden in the scarlet manor, that’s why.” One man answered.

Kagero were aware that the vampire and it’s allies lived in that manor. Kagero thought for moment, thinking that maybe he could find this artifact and use it to defend the village.

“Hm...that is a good information you’ve got...I think I should pay a visit there.” Kagero said.

Both mens gasped to hear that word, and told him not to go there, but Kagero insisted to go, so he turned to the village mayors office to see if he could grant his wish and went off..
12.title: Before the beginning

121.content:
“I didn’t do it!!”

That voice was heard in the underground city where many Youkai lived. One of the Youkai elder were looking down at the oni girl in green skirt and white shirts tied up.

“I already know that you killed four youkais and you know it.” Youkai elder said.

“You don’t know that, I have alibis!” Oni girl testified.

“I don’t care about your alibis, you imbecile! You are hereby exiled from our community, now get out!” Elder roared.

The oni sobbed, then turned to anger and wripped up the rope That bounded her and looked at them with hateful eyes.

“You all shall pay...you all will pay!!” Oni spoke in anger.

She then fled the scene and once she got out, the sun was setting. The oni gritted her teeth, wiping her tears away.

“I will never forgive them fools.” Oni spoke.

She then started her exile by hiding herself in the mountains..
121.title: Exiled oni

1211.content:
At the human village, Kagero was talking to the elder of the village. He explained to him about what he heared and wanted to use that artifact to protect the village even further.

“But Kagero, you do realize your meeting with the vampire, see?” Elder spoke.

“I know, but I can prove that I can do it,” Kagero said, “please elder! Let me find this artifact!”

He thought for moment as he poured some tea, he took some sip and looked at him.

“Alright, But please come back safely.” Elder said.

“Thank you Elder! I will not fail you!!” Kagero thanked him.

He then bowed to him and went back to his house for tonight. Next day dawned and the sky was gloomy with grey clouds. The villagers bid farewell to Kagero as he left with his bag full of food, water, cloth and a sword in case of defense. He walked through the open field and went into the forest to see if his direction was right until he felt the rain drop from his head.

“Oh no, it’s going to rain.” Kagero said.

The rain started to pour down and he started to run to see if there was any shelter around. It took him 20 minutes then he saw a big house not too far from him. He ran toward it and got to the front and banged on the door.

“Excuse me! Please let me in from the rain!” Kagero said.

He twisted the knob, then realized it was unlocked. He quietly opened the door, noticing that nobody have lived here for while. He went in, closed the door and took a deep breath.

“Phew, at least I am sheltered for now.” Kagero said, “but who’s house is this belongs to?”

He then went deeper and noticed the living room. He unpacked his bag and looked around until he noticed...
1211.title: Permission

12112.content:
Kagero noticed a folded paper with some sort of of charm around it. He wondered what the paper were and touched it until it sparked at his hand, flinched by it and backed off as he saw the paper floated up In midair, it unfolded itself and a hologram appeared. The hologram revealed as a man with mid long black hair, light purple skin and a horn sticking out.

“Greetings, visitor. If you are seeing this, then you are listening to my voice from past.” Man said.

(Who’s this man?) Kagero thought.

“Let me introduce myself. I am Beta Bluesteel, one of the member of blue-bell clan and the teacher of omega arts, the dark arts of magic combat.” He stated, “I am immortal, and have lived for over thousand years until I was exiled from my clan for marrying a mortal woman and having an half immortal daughter. My clan have died 10 years after my exile and my younger brothers have scattered elsewhere. After I have taught my daughter the art of omega, she was kidnapped and forcefully became an killing machine by being the strong dark mage. I knew she would be dangerous so I have sealed myself so she would be sealed in the book of dark magic and obituary. If you desire to live in this house, then I shall grant you my permission to live here. With that, I bid you farewell.”

With that’s, the paper swirled and caught on blue fire. It was on fire for moment and then it crumpled down in ashes. Kagero were little skeptical about what this beta person was talking about. He never heard of blue belle clan or any dark mages in the past. But this was Gensokyo, and he thought that maybe it might have existed back then.

“Well, I should unpack my stuff and look around this house.” Kagero said.

He then picked up his bag and looked around. He looked deeper and noticed the bathroom, room with toilet, kitchen and dining room. He then noticed the stares that leads to upstairs and once he got up he noticed two rooms. He went to the first room and it was normal room that had bed, desk and a window.

“I should take this room for myself.” Kagero said.

He then put the bag down and unpacked his cloth and put it in the closet near him. Once he did he got out and went to other room, revealing a room that were little girlish side on it.

“This might have been that mans daughters room.” Kagero spoke.

He then went downstairs to living room and sat down on the chair to wait until the rain stops.
12112.title: Notice from past

121122.content:
30 minutes passed as he changed cloth and drinking some tea, Kagero looked outside and noticed the rain stopped. He smiled and got his katana and got out toward the scarlet manor. He was aware the danger that awaits him but he put his courage and set forth to the area. It took an hour, and he finally made it to the manor as the place were red like crimson flames.

“I shouldn’t be afraid.” Kagero spoke.

He went forward and got to the gate. He noticed that nobody was guarding it so he slowly opened the gate and went toward the door until he felt disturbance and quickly side stepped, seeing a red headed female pounced down on the area he stood and he unsheathes he katana.

“What mortal like you comes to our manor?” Female asked.

“I just want questions to be answered. I don’t want a fight.” Kagero replied.

“Your trespassing my ladies property. I’m ordered to defend anyone who trespasses her land.” Lady replied.

She dashed toward him and he immediately dodged and swung the katana, barely hitting her right shoulder. She turns and came before him and punched his stomach, making him cough blood. He knelt before her and the red haired female were before him.

“You cannot beat me, now scram before-“

“I think you should stop meiling.”

Someone stopped the red headed lady and Kagero looked up, seeing a blue haired girl with light red dress on and a bat wings on her back.

“But lady remilia, he’s an intruder.” Meiling said.

“Yes, an intruder with good intentions...now mortal, why did you come to my domain?” Remilia asked.

(So that’s the vampire I hear at village) Kagero thought, still bleeding, “...I have heard an artifact that grants the wielder an unlimited power hidden in this place. Do you have it?”

Remilia thought for moment and then chuckled.

“If I had that, I would be invincible. But no, I don’t have it so why don’t you leave now?” Remilia said.

“But...I know it exists, please tell me!” Kagero spoke.

“I said I don’t know. Now go or I’ll deal with you.” Remilia replies.

Kagero were disappointed and knew he couldn’t fight against the vampire so he was about to leave but he was injured and he wobbled as he got up. Remilia noticed this and sighs and turns to meiling.

“Meiling, take him to one of the room so he could get some rest until he gets better.” Remilia said.

“But my lady..” Meiling spoke.

“No buts. Take him in.” Remilia said.

Meiling sighed and helped him get inside to get some rest. Meanwhile at the mansions library, a purple haired female in purple/white gowns sat reading some book while an red headed female in suit and four wings stood putting some books away. They were patchouli knowladge, the witch and Koakuma, her assistant. She was putting some books away until she noticed an unfamiliar book at the end of the hallway.

“What’s that...? Did master knowledge forgot to put it away?” Koakuma mumbled.

She came to the book and picked it up. It was a book leathered in pure black and had a crest of ruby that were so red it looked bathed in blood. She then looked at the title and it wrote:

Omega secrecy of dark magic and obituary

“I didn’t know master knowledge had this.” Koakuma said.

She then opens the book and saw many texts that it was horrific to her, even the gods would quiver in fear. She turns the pages and noticed pictures of mages with red liquid around itself.

“What is this..?” Koakuma spoke.

Then suddenly..

*sob* don’t kill me..

Koakuma turned and didn’t see anyone standing then the voice continued.

Please don’t kill me..*sob*

“Who are you!?” Koakuma spoke in fear.

Don’t kill me, please no...!!

She shivered down her spine and just knelt down in horror.

DON’T KILL ME, NO, NO,NO!!

Koakuma heart began to beat fast as fear came before her mind.

DONT KILL ME, FATHER HELP ME!! IYAAAA!

Koakuma then heard some sort of noise and looked up, and saw an shadow came down and gotten hanged.

GUGE!!??

“Iyaaa!!” Koakuma screamed in horror.

She was shivering in fear as she heard an heartbeat coming from the book. Moment later patchouli came to her and saw her on the floor. She came to her picking her up as Koakuma we’re shaking with tears.

“Koakuma! What’s wrong!? Something happened to you?” Patchouli asked.

“No..please...no more...” Koakuma murmured.

Patchouli couldn’t believe what she was looking at and noticed the book. She picked it up only to banish itself.

“What the...” patchouli spoke.

She then took Koakuma to her room to calm her down. Meanwhile, kagero was escorted to visitors room to get rest. He was told once he felt better, he should leave. He understood and laid back on the bed and it took...
121122.title: 30 minutes later

1211222.content:
Hour later, he felt better from the attack he received earlier. It still had light pain, but he endured it and bid farewell to the place and went back to the house. During his walk, he was wondering about what he should do now that they didn’t have the artifact.

“I could go back to the village, but the house needs someone to taken care of..” he mumbled.

He was thinking for at least an hour, returning back to the house he first saw. He then decided to stay here for at least a while so he could train to be better guardsmen.

“I guess I made up my mind.” He said.

He then went into the house to get some rest...
1211222.title: Back at the house

12112221.content:
Month went by and Kagero finished his training. He felt slightly stronger by the training, and once he unsheathes his katana, he went back in to take quick bath until he felt an light tremor. He looked out and noticed some birds flying away and he wondered.

“This tremor..is it just natural one?...I should check it out.” Kagero said.

He then got out and started to walk fast. It took at least 30 minutes for him to arrive at the mountain. He never came to the mountain as he heard some crow tengu lived here.

“Is it just me, or some sort of instinct of mine wants me to go..?” Kagero muttered.

He then proceeded to go to the mountain and it took an hour for him to reach the destination. He saw a small crater at the bottom of the field and he felt as he needed to see it. As he went down to look and arrives, he saw an oni Youkai standing before an carcass.

“An...oni?” Kagero spoke.

The oni then turned, looking with pale look, then turned back and started to walk away.

“Um, excuse me. Are you alone?” Kagero asked.

“What do you think, mortal?” Oni spoke.

“Well...um...do you want place to stay?” Kagero said.

He could tell she was not clean, her cloths were tattered and she looked malnourished. He came close to her but she just swung her fist, making him flinch and back off.

“I don’t need help mortal. Now go away, or I will kill you.” Oni said.

“Geez, is all youkais mind is killing and such?” Kagero said, “look, you look bad so I want to help you. I want to get you get back on your feet.”

“I said..I dont..need..”

Before she could finish, her stomach rumbles, and she fainted. Kagero thought for moment as if this was the opportunity to help her out. He picked her up and went back to his house. As he returns, he got in and laid her down and gotten ready for bath. As he completed in 30 minutes he came back to the oni and gently undressed her, revealing her skinny body with bruises.

“Oh man, I think it was a good idea to let her in.” Kagero said.

He then picked her up and took her to bathing room and got some shampoo and body soap and started to clean her up. As he did, he scrubbed her hair and her body, and once putting her on the tub, he let her soak for 10 minutes and then once out, he dried her up with towel and went to the upper room and dressed her with the cloth in the dresser.

“Nice dream.” Kagero said.

He then went away while the oni were unconscious...
12112221.title: First meeting

121122211.content:
Next day came and the oni opened her eyes. She got up, looking around at the unfamiliar area. She looked at her body, noticing that new set of cloths were on. She brainstorm for moment, trying to remember what happened until she remember that a mortal man came to her.

“Did he help me?” Oni spoke softly.

She got out of the bed and went out of the room. She went downstairs and noticed a food on the table. She came to the food and saw a paper next to it. She picked it up, and it wrote:

Eat and get replenish

“That mortal..” Oni spoke.

She then started to eat the food slowly, then ate little faster due to the taste being good. Her tears fell from her eyes as she ate, she heard someone came in, and looked. It was Kagero and he put the towel away.

“I see your enjoying the food.” Kagero said.

“Why did you save me, mortal? I thought I told you to back off.” Oni asked.

“Human instinct, I think. I just wanted to help you out, that’s all.” Kagero replies, “and I think you should wipe your tears off.”

She noticed the tears and wiped it and continued to eat as Kagero chuckled, he asked for her name.

“..My name is Kooni Yamaoku.” She replied.

“And I am Kagero Onitsuka. Nice to be an aquatinted.” Kagero replied.

He came to her and petted her head. She hated being petted by mortal human, but she felt that he saved her so she let it slide.

“What were you doing just now?” Kooni asked.

“Me? I was just finished up my training with my katana.” Kagero answered, “now finish your food so we could have some walk out.”

She hesitated but agreed to do it. After breakfast he took the plates and went to sink to wash it while Kooni relaxes. After a moment he came back and told to get ready to go out. As they did, they went out and walked for while, telling themselves about who they are and what purpose they were in.

“So you were exiled from your clan, huh?” Kagero asked.

“Yes, and I made a choice to never trust anybody.” Kooni said, “your the first human I met that helped me out.”

“I’m glad I helped you.” Kagero said, “Say, if you don’t have anywhere to go home, you can always stay with me.”

This was a news for Kooni as he was offering a shelter for her, an exiled oni. She always been told youkais could never mingle with humans as their life span is short and they were weak animals. But something was telling her that this man was different and he was trustworthy.

“Are..you sure? I’m an oni, I can kill you if my instinct becomes violent.” Kooni asked.

“I’ll see about that when that day comes.” Kagero said, “will you join me, ms.yamaoku?”

She was silent for moment and Kagero hugged her. He petted her head again, and whispered to her.

“It’s ok, everything will be just fine.” Kagero said.

“If..that’s your decision, then I shall..accompany you.” Kooni replies.

She hugged him back but gently, knowing her power could crush him easily.

Just then..
121122211.title: Befriend the oni

1211222111.content:
Suddenly a group of youkais appears before the two. Kagero were surprised, but he got his katana ready as the youkais were tengu Youkai.

“What is your reason here, Youkai? It seems that your not here without a cause.” Kagero spoke.

“We came for the oni, so step aside human.” Tengu replied.

Kagero looked at Kooni and she was frowning for moment and then he got to his stance to fight.

“If you’re here to do harm on her, then you made yourself a new enemy.” Kagero said.

“Ha, What could an mortal human could do? Swing with that toy sword on us? How laughable.” Tengu laughed.

“You’ll be laughing now, but you have underestimated me.” Kagero replied.

He then dashed toward and swung the sword, hitting one of the Tengu. He bled and Kooni were astonished for him to defend her. She smiled as the Tengu youkais began to attack him, she rose her hand at them. Kagero and the youkais began to feel heaviness and the youkais dropped to the ground.

“Have you youkais forgot that I have power to manipulate gravity. Now die, fools.” Kooni said.

She pushed the youkais down, squashing them with then spewing blood. Kagero were astonished to see this and turned to Kooni.

“Kooni, you..”

“Do t worry Kagero, it’s my fault they tried to attack us. I just did what I should do.” Kooni said.

Just then, more reinforcements came and the fight began as Kagero swings his katana, Kooni punched and kicked the youkais face and body. After 20 mi utes of fighting, the remaining tengu youkais were in bad shape and got the living ones.

“Damn you human and oni, we will not forget this!” Youkais spoke.

They then left the scene, leaving many dead youkais on the ground.

“What should we do about these dead one?”Kooni asked.

“We should at least bury them.” Kagero replied.

Just as he was about to get some item to dig a hole, Kooni felt an dark presence and told him to stop. He asked what’s wrong until he noticed a black hole appearing and from it, a book materialized and fell on the ground. Kagero and Kooni didn’t know how the book appears before them and as Kagero was about to pick it up, the book floated, and it opened itself.

“What the..!” Kagero spoke.

The book then made a mage circle and summoned a black flames, incinerating the dead bodies. Both Kagero and Kooni defended themselves as the flames were so black it could turn the day to night. Kagero lowers his arm and came closer to the book and stood before it.

“Kagero? What are you doing?” Kooni asked.

“I think..I found the thing I heared back at the village.” Kagero said, “So this is the artifact...it was a book after all.”

The book then closed itself and Kagero took the book. He read the books title as it was a dark book of obituary. The crested ruby made him wonder if this book could help him get stronger.

“Kooni, I’m taking this book for my future training.” Kagero said.

“But Kagero, I feel disturbed by this book. Are you sure it’s ok?” Kooni asked.

“It will be fine, trust me.” Kagero said.

She felt skeptical but agrees to let him hold on to it. They went back in and had some dinner, took bath and went to sleep.
1211222111.title: Battle of the fittest

12112221111.content:
Next day approached and Kagero was outside as Kooni were still sleeping. Kagero looked at the book for moment and then opened it. It had many text that he couldn’t since it was an unknown language.

“Damn, how can I train when I don’t understand what this book is written?” Kagero spoke.

Just then, he saw the texts move, and it transformed into a text that he could understand. He was surprised by this and started to read the book.

“Lets see...the great mage war ended in stagnation between alpha and omega tribes, fusioned by one master to become the clan of chosened one...huh, I wonder..” Kagero spoke.

He flipped few more pages until he noticed the pages on how to use the omega style magic and combats.

“Ah, there it is...let’s see. This is called..the ‘dark chains’...it feeds upon the casters blood and it turns into a bloody chains, piercing at the enemy’s and on...so I need to bleed myself?” Kagero spoke.

He then took out a Tantō and looked at his wrist. He breathed in and slit his wrist. Pain flowed him as he blood fell, he spoke the chant from the book. The black book made an dark aura, and the blood then took form of chains and surrounded him. He felt astonished by this and looked at one of the tree and gotten ready to attack.

“Chains, attack!” Kagero shouted.

The bloody chains then struck the tree, making a huge hole on it and it fell down. Kageros eyes were wide as he looked at his arm now strapped with bloody chains, and he smiled.

“This power, this is what I seemed. I can now become more powerful so I can protect the village from harm!!” Kagero said.

He then laughed lightly and continued to study the book until he noticed Kooni standing, rubbing her eyes.

“Kooni, did I wake you up?” Kagero asked.

“I felt some dark presence while I was asleep..was it you?” Kooni asked.

Kagero was quiet for moment and then smiled as the dark chains surrounded him, Koonis sleepiness faded away and opened her eyes.

“Kooni, I can now train more thanks to this book. With this, I can now defend the one I care about by destroying the enemy from anywhere!” Kagero said.

“Kagero..” Kooni spoke softly.

“Don’t worry, I wouldn’t dare harm you. You are my allies you see? I’ll never put my hands on you.” Kagero said.

Kooni came closer to him as she saw his iris turn slit for moment and then turns back to normal. She felt little uncomfortable by this but it was him that saved her life from loneliness and hunger.

“If you choose to go to that road, then I will accompany you.” Kooni said.

“Thank you Kooni. I am truly grateful to have you on my side.” Kagero replied.

He looked back at the book and read some texts and he spoke few words and his wounds were healed. Kooni were amazed to see this and looked at him.

“Kagero, you were injured?” Kooni asked.

The man nodded, “the omega arts needs blood in order to harness the power and ability.”

Just then, the ruby glowed and Kagero sheathed the wakizashi and slit his belly area. As it bled, Kagero turns some pages and saw the page on how to wield sword related omega style Magic’s.

“Lets see..concentrate the blood into the sword and it becomes more deadly..also known as ‘dark sword’..I should use my katana and wakizashi for this.” Kagero said.

He unsheathes his katana as he remembers the word, he put the book down and chanted, making the blood trail go to the sword. It surrounded the blade and it made an dark aura on it, making Kagero grin and looked at other trees.

“Lets see if my sword became stronger.” Kagero said.

He swiped both his sword, making a blood blade to run at the tree and it cut it clean. As the tree fell, kageros grin become little sinister and Kooni noticed it.

“This for the brighter future, for the safety of my village.” Kagero said.

The books ruby shines redder and the blood that Kagero spilled suddenly went toward the book. The two noticed it and when the blood covered the book and touched the ruby, it opened itself. Both Kagero and Kooni came close and noticed a picture of young girl with black hair and some sort of tribal cloth on its book.

“Who’s she?” Kooni asked.

Kagero picked it up and read the line.

“Sakura, Master mage of omega style...this is intriguing.” Kagero said.

Just then, the book floated and backed off, covered itself in blood and black smog. They didn’t know what was going on until someone came out of the smog. It was the same girl, but with black coat on her. Kooni gotten ready to fight as she felt that she was an enemy.

And then...
12112221111.title: Power of darkness

121122211112.content:
“Are you the one who uses my book?”

Kagero sand Kooni looked at her as she asked the question. The girl, with blackhair with brown/purple Heterochromian eyes with slit pupil looking at them. Kooni didn’t know what to say then Kagero came forward.

“I am. My name is Kagero Onitsuka, a mortal who seek power to defend the one I care.” Kagero said.

There was a silence and then the girl spoke up.

“I see. I am Sakura Blubelle, daughter of immortal father and mortal mother, and a master of omega style dark magic.” She said, “and as for this defending thing...are you sure you are strong enough to use this magic properly?”

“I think I am.” Kagero answered.

There was an anger vein on her forehead and then she suddenly disappeared, only to reappearing infront of Kagero. Kooni used her power but Sakura immediately summoned two swords from darkness and cut her arms.

“Gyaa!!” Kooni screeched in pain.

“Kooni!!” Kagero responded.

Just then, Sakura puts two swords on his throat. He felt terrified by her presence as she looked down at him and Kooni were in pain, the blood of oni swirled around Sakura and made an braided chains and pointed at Kagero.

“I don’t take any users of my book lightly. If you can use it, you must have the power to use it.” Sakura said, “no ifs or buts.”

“You....I...I can use it!” Kagero said.

“Oh? Then hit me your best shot boy.” Sakura said, “but before that..”

She then turns to Kooni and casted a spell. The arm that were chopped away came back to Kooni and healed itself. Kooni couldnt believe what she was seeing as the dark mage backed off, she told Kagero to fight now. He dashed toward her with his katana and fought her but she easily defended herself by the blood that Kooni spilled and then she used her sword to cover with blood, making a dark sword and pointed at him.

“C’mon boy, is that all you’ve got?” Sakura spoke.

“Grraa!!” Kagero shouted.

He too made an dark sword and they both clashed. Kagero were hitting hard as Sakura just smiled and looked at him.

“You are just like the others: weak of heart and easily consumed by the darkness.” Sakura said.

“What?” Kagero spoke.

“I’m going to show you the proper way of using magic.” Sakura said.

Just then, a gust of dark wind hit him and blew him to the back. As he did, Sakura summoned two lances from darkness and blood, stabbing him hard and finally when hime hit on the tree, Sakura stabbed his stomach with the dark sword. Kagero coughed blood as he was bleeding badly, the blood was only going toward the lances and the sword.

“This is the way me and my ancestors have fought against the light mages long time ago.” Sakura said.

“Long time....ago?..you mean-“

“Yes, the great mage war that happened over 10,000 years ago.” Sakura said.

She then took off the sword and the lances away, dropping him down to the ground. The weapons faded away as he was dying from bleeding, Sakura looked at him.

“Even if your that weak, do you still want to become like me, a dark mage?” Sakura asked.

There were silence, and she just sighed and was about to leave until she heard him getting up. He was bleeding, but he was still determined to be stronger.

“Please...teach me everything...you know, so I can...*cough* defend the one I care...the most..” Kagero said.

He then fell again on the ground. She thought for moment and then turned and came to him, healing his wounds with dark recovery. When he was recovered, Sakura just looking at him and then smiled.

“Your training shall start tomorrow.” Sakura said, “for now, get some rest.”

She helped get him up by floating and went back to the house. Kooni were there and hugged Kagero as they arrived, he petted her head.

“Kagero, Kagero!! I thought you were dead!” Kooni said with some tears.

“Do not worry, little oni. I will become stronger as for today, Sakura becomes my master.” Kagero said.

Kooni looked at her and bowed to her for not killing him. She just chuckled and both Sakura and Kooni took him to the bed room...
121122211112.title: Dark master

1211222111121.content:
Later at night when Kooni were asleep, kagero was outside looking at the sky. He was thinking about becoming the dark mage itself and then he heard a door open. It was Sakura and she came to him with a sake gourd on her.

“Can’t sleep, my apprentice?” Sakura asked.

“Yes...say, about your history. I want to know little bout it.” Kagero said.

“My history? You mean the history of mages?” Sakura asked.

He nodded and she thought for moment and told him to go to the other side of the house. He didn’t know why but he went as she followed, they got to the area. She spoke in ancient tongue, and a portal was opened, revealing a beautiful land with grassy land and some tree sprouting. She told him to go in and as they got in, Sakura started to talk.

“You see, 10,000 years ago, there was a war between the alpha mages and omega mages, that would be known as the great mage war. Nobody knows what caused the war, but the death toll were magnificently high to the point they almost went extinct. Fortunately, one hero who became the master of both alpha and omega arts ended the war, making them the pact that they will fuse to become a the clan that later be known as bluebell clan.” Sakura started to speak, “the clan had issues, but lived together for over many millenniums. They had one thing in mind: never let a mortal live in the land.”

“Why is that master?” Kagero asked.

“They believed that mortals blood were impure, and it would stain the purity of the clans bloodline. My father broke that law by marrying my mother, a mortal. For that he and my mother were exiled from the village. I don’t know why, but the clan then were destroyed with in decade later.” Sakura said.

They then got to the tall tree with gravestone infront of the tree. On the gravestone it wrote:

Here lies Sakurako, wife of immortal and mother of half blooded daughter

May your soul be free in this garden.

“Master, this is..” Kagero spoke.

“This is my mothers grave. She died from giving birth to me.” Sakura said.

Kagero were little saddened by this and he lightly bowed to the grave. Sakura looked at him and smiled at him.

“You know, your the first human to set foot in this sacred grove.” Sakura said, “you should be honored.”

“And I am.” He replied, “Say, why were you in the book?”

“I was deemed too dangerous, so my father sealed me into the book by using his soul and his body as the catalyst. I managed to break free for moment after I took some sip of your blood.” Sakura replies.

He nodded and they went back outside and sakura closed the portal. He then went to the bed room to sleep as Sakura looked at the sky, she drank some sake and grinned.

“This might be an opportunity to train him properly.” Sakura said.

She then went back in to go to sleep...
1211222111121.title: Little history

12112221111211.content:
15 years passed since the training started, and a lot have changed for Kagero. He learned many dark magic and sword combats from sakura herself. Kooni supported him as massage person to training partner. With that, Kooni started to call him ‘master’ as she learned some omega style as well from Kagero himself. After the training, Sakura clapped her hands.

“Good, you are doing great job my apprentice.” Sakura said, “you might have became even with me.”

“Thank you master. I have learned many things from you.” Kagero said.

She thought for moment then she came to him and touched his shoulder.

“As for today, you are now graduated student and I shall see you as a master mage, and I shall rename you...Mu, the nothing.” Sakura said.

“The..nothing?” Kagero said.

Sakura nods, “your power will bring them into the nothing, that’s why I chose that name.”

“I see..thank you master Sakura.” Kagero thanked her.

He then saw her start to fade away in darkness. He didn’t know what was going on as she looked at her arms, she just smiled.

“I guess it’s my time to leave this world for while.” Sakura said.

“What? But no! You can’t leave us master!” Kagero spoke.

“It can’t be helped. If I stay any further my father might wake up and many catastrophe might come.” Sakura said as the darkness engulfed her, she smiled, “I’ll leave the rest up to you, my apprentice.”

With that, the darkness engulfed her completely and vanished, leaving the dark book on the ground. Kagero were saddened and as he picked up the book, he held the book tightly and turned to Kooni.

“Kooni, I am going back to my village. I want you to stay here to watch over the house.” Kagero spoke.

“But Master, I cant just see you go alone.” Kooni spoke.

“I’m doing this for your own good Kooni. I don’t want you to get hurt by my fellow humans.” Kagero spoke.

He then handed the book to Kooni, telling her to defend the book as long as she lives. She had some tears flowing down and Kagero just smile and petted her head.

“Don’t worry, I will be alive and I’ll come back when time comes.” Kagero said.

She wiped her tears and nodded and he left the scene, bidding farewell to his oni friend. It took him 30 minutes to reach the destination and once he arrived, he saw the guards standing at the gate. As he walked, they stopped him with spears across the gate.

“Halt, who goes through the gate?” Guard asked.

“I am Kagero Onizuka, one of the person who worked as a guard here.” Kagero responded.

“Kagero? You mean..the one who searched for the artifact?” Guard asked.

“That’s me.” Kagero responded.

“We must tell the elder he’s back, follow me.” One guard spoke.

Kagero nodded and went in. The village never changed and once he got to the elders house, the guard told him to wait and went inside. 5 mi utes later, he came back with elder coming out.

“Oh Kagero, it have been 15 years. Where were you all along?” Elder asked.

“I’m sorry for the delay, I have found the artifact that I seeked and trained in isolated area.” Kagero answered.

“Please, come in. We must discuss over this matter.” Elder said.

He nodded and went inside as the silhouette of a female stood not too far. Back at the house, Kooni were worried about Kagero, but trusted his words that he’ll be back and held the book tight. Back in the village, Kagero told everything he knew to the elder and how he became stronger than before.

“I see, so the artifact was a book that had many variations of magic.” Elder said.

“Yes, and because of that I have became a mage who wields weapons as well.” Kagero replied.

He then summoned a small black fireball infront of the elder. He was astonished to see this and smiled.

“I see, I see..well then, I shall approve your-“

“Hold on a second!!”

The voice stopped elders approval for Kagero and they turned to see a long blue haired female with light blue dress and a weird blue hat on.

“Ms.Kamishirasawa, what’s wrong?” Elder asked.

She was Keine Kamishirasawa, a were-hakutaku Youkai who teaches at the school.

“I sense a darkness from that man. I do not approve him at all!” Keine said.

“But ms.kamishirasawa, he came back to defend us.” Elder spoke.

“No, I sense bloodlust from him. Do not fall for it Elder.” Keine said.

“Same as mine, sir.” Voice spoke.

From behind a short purple haired girl in kimono walked.

“Ms.Hieda.” Elder said.

She was Hieda No Akyuu, one of the humans who have ability to never forget once remember.

“I do not trust one bit from him, so I would reconsider your decision.” Akyuu said.

Kagero became annoyed and stood up as both Keine and Akyuu looked at him with stern eyes.

“How dare you say such things. I came back to defend this village, not destroy it. You two are just saying without logic.” Kagero said.

“We have logic, mr.onizuka, and we shall not let you be free any further.” Keine said.

Elder was worried but then Kagero smirked.

“Fine, I’ll deal with you right now!” Kagero spoke.

He u sheathed the swords and tackled Keine. They fought as Akyuu and the elder saw the fight.

The fight lasted.
12112221111211.title: Fully fledged mage

121122211112111.content:
It took an hour, and Keine were troubled as Kagero were surrounded by a blood chains, his katana were turned into a dark sword. Keine rushes toward him but he stabbed her with the chains. Keine screamed in pain as she panted, she saw his eye color turned into red/purple Heterochromia.

“You are a fool, Kamishirasawa, for standing up against me.” Kagero said.

“Grr...haah...is this the power hidden in his..blood?” Keine spoke in pain.

Kagero then crossed his sword and built some power. Keine realized he was about to deliver the final blow on her.

“Now die, you worm! Dark..cross!!!” Kagero shouted.

He slashed and the x-shaped blade ran toward her. She closed her eyes, believing she’ll die, but something stopped the attack. She opened her eyes and saw a Miko standing with a talesman guarding the attack. Once it went away, the Miko came forward.

“I had bad feeling about it..so it was you, huh?” Miko spoke.

“You..you’re that Hakurei Miko, aren’t you?” Kagero said.

“I am.” Miko said, “and I’m here to put end to your actions.”

Kagero grinned and laughed, then he put the wakizashi away, only his katana open, ready to fight.

“Let’s dance, my enemy. I’m the one who’ll defend this land.” Kagero said.

“Lets see about that.” Miko replies.

They then started to fight. Back at the house, Kooni could no longer wait for Kagero to come back so she out to find him at the human village. Back at the village, the fight was on as the Hakurei Miko used her fist and the spirit stick to fight against Kagero. As the fight intensified, kagero was about to attack her until two gaps opened and a hands grabbed his hands.

“What the!?” Kagero spoke in shock.

Miko then used her fist and punched his stomach hard. He coughed blood as it spilled it to the ground, he noticed a female in purple dress coming out next to Hakurei Miko. It was Yukari Yakumo, the gap Youkai.

“You...you did this did didn’t you!?” Kagero spoke in anger.

“I cannot tolerate such vile man like you being free. Now you will perish here right now.” Yukari said.

Kagero..then laughed. They didn’t know why he was laughing then he stood up lightly.

“You fool. I have people behind me. As long as they trust me, I’ll never be defeated.” Kagero said.

He turned around, then he noticed the civilians backing off, even the elder himself. He didn’t know why they were backing off then the elder spoke.

“Kagero..I think I have changed my mind...please leave this village.” Elder said.

“But..Elder! I came to protect you all!! Why do you say such thing!?” Kagero asked.

“Your not what you used to be. You were humble and modest...now you are nothing more than a beast lusting for blood..guards, help the Miko.” Elder spole.

The guards came to Miko and Yukari and gotten ready to fight. Kagero were dumbfounded by this and were speechless for moment, then he cackled in laughter and looked at the two females with hate.

“Fine, If you all will betray me, then I shall kill you all!!” Kagero said.

The dark chains surrounded then hit the puddle of blood, than exploaded, shooting an blood needles. Many humans died, even the guards got hit and died from it. The Miko and Yukari got scraped and used their powers and put barriers around him, and using the special power to seal him.

“arrgg!!let..me..go!!” Kagero shouted in anger.

“You shall be sealed in the powerful seal for very long time. So you should say good bye now.” Yukari said.

“Nooo!!”

The voice came from back and it came out. It was Kooni herself and she was in tears as Kagero realized he couldn’t do anything anymore.

“Kooni....my dear friend...I will leave now, but we’ll meet again.” Kagero said.

He then turned to the humans and others.

“As for everybody, you all shall remember the day when I, Mu, shall come back with vengeance!!” Kagero shouted in anger.

The light the engulfed him and he was sealed in hell. Kooni cried as both Miko and Yukari came to her, Yukari looked at her.

“She’ll be dangerous, so I shall banish her myself.” Yukari said.

Before she could open the gap, lol I jumped and punched her face. She wobnled as Miko tried to stop her, Kooni used her gravity ability and slammed her.

“You will see him again, you worms, I garentee he will return!” Kooni said.

She then fled the scene, using the power of darkness she learned from Kagero. Miko stood up little as Yukari helped her up and then came to Keine.

“We shall have this peace for while.” Yukari said.

“Yes, we should have it.” Keine replied.

And thus the human village returns to peace.
121122211112111.title: Final hour of dark mage

1211222111121111.content:
One year passes and the human village were fixed from the rampage caused by kagero. They lived in harmony but in the elders house, he had some regret betraying one of his best guardsmen in the village.

“I know the Miko and others told he was dangerous...but he was a good man.” Elder said.

He went outside, looking at the sky thinking about Kagero. He than went back in to his house to do work as the mountain where the elder youkais met, Yukari were speaking out.

“And thanks to the efforts of Hakurei Miko, the dark mage is no longer in this area.” Yukari said.

“And he will be sealed in hell?” One elder asked.

“Yes, that’s right.” Yukari answered.

They talked as Yukari continued to speak out.

In the house, the dark book stayed as it was silent, one oni came down. It was kooni and she was crying at her room. She was depressed, and as she looked at the book, her heart were hardened.

“I’ll wait for you master...so we can have revenge on everyone..” Kooni spoke.

She then left the scene as the ruby blowed little and it stopped glowing...

Thus end the prequel of Gensokyo gaiden
1211222111121111.title: Fragile peace

info.description:
The darkness shrouds Gensokyo, and evil lurks the land. What the evil is, it shall reveal soon.

(This is revised version of 2010s Gensokyo geiden)
